intro: Lotononis debilis, commonly known as the slender lotonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has slender, branching stems with small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, making it a notable species in its native habitat. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
